about.description:
Utilities for building and testing atomic machine learning models.
Gaussian Processes (GP) regression machine learning routines are
implemented. These will take any numpy array of training and test
feature matrices along with a vector of target values.
In general, any data prepared in this fashion can be fed to the
GP routines, a number of additional functions have been added that
interface with ASE. This integration allows for the manipulation of
atoms objects through GP predictions, as well as dynamic generation
of descriptors through use of the many ASE functions.
about.summary: A machine learning environment for atomic-scale modeling in surface science and catalysis.

about.description:
Utilities for building and testing atomic machine learning models.
Gaussian Processes (GP) regression machine learning routines are
implemented. These will take any numpy array of training and test
feature matrices along with a vector of target values.
In general, any data prepared in this fashion can be fed to the
GP routines, a number of additional functions have been added that
interface with ASE. This integration allows for the manipulation of

of descriptors through use of the many ASE functions.
about.summary: A machine learning environment for atomic-scale modeling in surface science and catalysis.

name: catlearn
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "catlearn" %}
{% set version = "0.6.2" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/C/CatLearn/CatLearn-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 5af6622e4660f3b5760267fccd9c5da6f1a4a88aad0aacc044067a68f92e2bbd

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 1
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - ase >=3.17.0
    - click >=6.7
    - cycler >=0.10.0
    - decorator >=4.3.0
    - flask >=1.0.2
    - h5py >=2.7.1
    - itsdangerous >=0.24
    - jinja2 >=2.10
    - kiwisolver >=1.0.1
    - markupsafe >=1.0
    - networkx >=2.1.0
    - numpy >=1.14.3
    - pandas >=0.23.0
    - psutil >=5.4.3
    - pyparsing >=2.2.0
    - python-dateutil >=2.7.3
    - pytz >=2018.4
    - scikit-learn >=0.19.1
    - scipy >=1.1.0
    - six >=1.11.0
    - tqdm >=4.23.3
    - werkzeug >=0.14.1

test:
  requires:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
  imports:
    - catlearn
  commands:
    - pip check

about:
  home: https://github.com/SUNCAT-Center/CatLearn
  license: GPL-3.0
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: A machine learning environment for atomic-scale modeling in surface science and catalysis.

  description: |
    Utilities for building and testing atomic machine learning models. 
    Gaussian Processes (GP) regression machine learning routines are 
    implemented. These will take any numpy array of training and test 
    feature matrices along with a vector of target values.
    In general, any data prepared in this fashion can be fed to the 
    GP routines, a number of additional functions have been added that 
    interface with ASE. This integration allows for the manipulation of 
    atoms objects through GP predictions, as well as dynamic generation 
    of descriptors through use of the many ASE functions.    
  doc_url: http://catlearn.readthedocs.io/
  dev_url: https://github.com/SUNCAT-Center/CatLearn

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jan-janssen
